text:
Hey guys,

Is it possible to add more field in the blog post, without making changes to the listing template? Now it's only the title and de post body.
Should i create an module and then add it to the post template?
yes you CAN add a module to the post template, you can also add HubL supported tags to the <head> area and export to template context and print them where you want on the actual page
Okay, so i made the module now with a simple rich text field. I tried to make it available in blogs, but i can't see the module there. do you have any reason why?

Made this module and added it in the template but i get this message everytime:
Error:Cannot resolve property "module"

responded to Finn in a DM because I was DMed but this is useful for everyone:
ahh yeah… unfortunately you can’t put it in the blog content module itself - current limitation they recently added. you can put it elsewhere in your drag n drop template though.

I have an idea forum post requesting them to allow module tags inside of the blog content module again if you’re interested in upvoting it:
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Add-back-support-for-the-use-of-HubL-tags-inside-of-the-blog/idi-p/259774>

I was able to use HubL to include a module inside the rich text area of a blog post when I did the view source mode to place it in. Naturally, i needed to save and reload the page in order for the module options to load but it was something I was able to do
I dont think its actually supported but it worked, I wouldnt recommend doing this unless needed though as an update would break it this im sure
you can make changes in view source mode and have them actually take effect in a drag n drop template?
this was a custom coded template, but the content was added to the post body module for the post
ahh
so i assume it should work in both as it was done in a module that is included in both
I know 1 thing that does matter with this is that old sites made before the DM2 switch don’t have this limitation (atleast for existing templates)

here is a sample using the D&D blog template:
<http://blog.wsol.com/-temporary-slug-fb2ec1b5-fd34-4d19-85a6-7a786912961d?hs_preview=bIbbjSbS-8654112805>
the images in the middle of the post are a module added into the rich text editor
ohh addded into the rich text editor, you mean like the blog’s content?
yep
interesting
like i said, not sure if this is actually supported or suppose to work but it does ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
I’m with ya, it’s probably not advisable but hey if you have to do something quick n dirty and it’s not a big deal how long it stays working :thumbsup_all:
